# Data
The survey data that is presented within this paper is obtained from the 2021 United States General Social Survey (GSS). 

## Survey methodology
The US GSS was created to collect public opinion and sentiment within the United States. The main component of the GSS is the replicating core, a central set of questions repeated in each year for the purpose of exploring trends in opinion over time. Additional modules present but not always consistently asked from year to year include topical questions relevant to the year. A major strength of the US GSS is in its long existence and replicating core, allowing tracking of contemporary sentiments over a significant period of time.
